channel.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
channel.description:
[url='https://video.ap.org/?f=None&pid=oT7qj_wiVHTbYae3scwok4_irYjJ2R8Z']Man being shot in anti-government riot. (If you're very sensitive to that kind of thing don't click it.)[/url]
[url='https://yro.slashdot.org/story/11/01/28/0114217/Egypt-Shuts-Off-All-Internet-Access']Egypt Shuts Off All Internet Access[/url] [url='https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&cd=1&ved=0CBwQqQIwAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Ftechcrunch.com%2F2011%2F01%2F27%2Fegypt-situation-gets-worse-people-reporting-internet-and-sms-shutdown%2F&rct=j&q=egypt%27s%20internet%20shut%20off&ei=YB1CTYaOJsmr8AbCpJX8AQ&usg=AFQjCNH_K04i9lRSkJnxJtz28yBxVIauvw&sig2=pFQtRkdtdJpuKt1sVATr1A&cad=rja']No Internet in Egypt - TechCrucnh[/url] [QUOTE=A Comment on Slashdot] Egyptian authorities apparently pulled the backbone plugs. [twitter.com] As a result of the Egyptians protesting, because the Tunisians protested, because of a Wikileaked document, from a US Embassy saying the truth - there was an old, fucked up dictatorship. [/QUOTE]

item.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Are they making a video game about it? Because otherwise this is the wrong subsection. C’mon, you’re a headcrab, you should know this.

In any case, I wonder if this is actually the start of something in the mid-east. Would be cool if it was, but I fear it may be short lived, especially if the governments succeed at limiting internet access.

It means that for the next few months, there will be no Egyptians playing video games on the internet. So if they were any better than South Koreans, that would actually mean something.

Read full topic

item.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
item.dc:creator: Acristoff
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Actually, the US President always had that power since the advent of the Internet. Nice spin.

That said, it will NEVER happen here. The US relies too much on the economic stimulus created by the Internet and nearly every big company headquartered in the US relies on the Internet for major portions of revenue. Take Amazon as a prime example.

No, it won’t happen; it’s just fearmongering by “zOMFG Odumbo’s shutting down the toobz!” people.

Except you know, they can try and shut down unfavorable sites.

Read full topic
item.source: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue

item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Maverix26:

:facepalm: my god, you’re an ignorant retard.

Yea, I heard that twitter, and facebook were blocked, but the entire internet? wow…

Maybe you forgot to read the part where it said, " don’t take that too seriously " .
You know… as in… a joke. I was trying to sound like the typical stupid American. It was… ah forget it.

item.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
The guard and the police are loyal to the president, and are unpopular with the people. Since the unrest began they’ve been using extremely heavy handed tactics. They’re also the kind gentleman that put electrodes on your teeth and bollocks when you’re in prison.

The army is seen in a much more favourable light, partly owing to their work in the war with Israel. Their loyalty will be crucial to the outcome of the unrest, but they’re liked by the people and not as heavy handed as the civil agencies. In fact, they used force against the border guards during their strikes in the early years of the president’s rule.

The army’s been deployed to Cairo, but they were greeted with cheering and it’s hoped they’ll keep the police in line

Read full topic
item.source: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue

item.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Solokiller:

Why doesn’t one of the Egyptian president’s [COLOR=‘Red’]loyal guards assassinate him and end it
already? Come on, he’s been in power for 30 years, that’s way too long to remain objective, even for a biased point of view that’s bad.

That’s why.

Why would the privileged risk all they got because of the population ?

Read full topic

item.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

America should walk in with a legion of Abrams Tanks and just scare them into sense. If they don’t comply, empty some tanks shells into the crowd. See if that does’nt work…

You mean a job for the World Police!

The government issues instructions to ISPs and mobile phone networks to cut off internet access. Vodafone have released a statement saying that they have to comply, it’s the law. There’s no ‘big red button’

Some people are saying they’re getting around the block with dial up connections

Read full topic
item.source: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue

item.title: Egypt's Internet Disabled as Anti-Government Riots Continue
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
k3nny1550:

I hear the Obama administration is planning to make something similar here in the US. Keep your eyes open folks, the government boogeyman is here to slip our liberty roofies.

Actually, the US President always had that power since the advent of the Internet. Nice spin.

That said, it will NEVER happen here. The US relies too much on the economic stimulus created by the Internet and nearly every big company headquartered in the US relies on the Internet for major portions of revenue. Take Amazon as a prime example.

No, it won’t happen; it’s just fearmongering by “zOMFG Odumbo’s shutting down the toobz!” people.

Read full topic
